newsitem.title: TURKEY: Turkish share rally continues, index up 7.3 pct.
newsitem.headline: Turkish share rally continues, index up 7.3 pct.

text.p: Istanbul shares continued to surge on Thursday afternoon prompted by the constitutional court's rejection of a challenge to a law enabling the privatisation of Turk Telekom, brokers said.
The IMKB National-100 .XU100 stood at 1,347 at 1334 GMT, up 96 points, or 7.67 percent from Wednesday's all-time high closing of 1,251.
"There was major cash entry which could be seen from the sharp rise in trade volume. Lively activity is likely to continue until the close (at 1400 GMT)," Nazmi Sarikaya from Disbank.
Session volume soared to 25.7 trillion lira with half an hour to go before the close, from 12.45 trillion in the whole of the first session.
Daily volume is seen hitting a new record at close, compared to Wednesday's 29.40 trillion and a previous high of 35.89 trillion lira on November 29, 1996.

The court cancelled only a sentence regarding the legal supervision of GSM licence agreements by the Council of State and rejected the rest of the application for the cancellation of articles in the law.

Court officials said the decision gave a green light to the sell-off of Telekom or the making of licence agreements for GSMs. The government expects to raise $3.5 billion from Telekom privatisation and another $1 billion from GSM licence agreements later this year.
The IMKB National-100 ended the first session at a new midday record of 1,271, up 20 points from Wednesday's all-time high close of 1,251.
